availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William G. Mountjoy (Anderson County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Anderson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Ann Eliza Chambers Mountjoy on April 20, 1842. Father of Emma V. Mountjoy, Charles Mountjoy, Nannie Mountjoy, Sarah "Sallie" Mountjoy, James E. Mountjoy, John A. Mountjoy, Susan M. Mountjoy, and William Mountjoy. Farmer in Anderson County in 1840. Owned one enslaved person in Anderson County in 1840. Farmer in Anderson County in 1850. Farmer in Anderson County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Anderson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 97.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 220A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, pp. 558-59.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 17.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, District 1, p. 318B.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), Anderson County 1831-1869, Film # 001550673, p. 962.
Find A Grave, "William G. Mountjoy (1840-1910)," Memorial 65892935, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/65892935 (accessed May 6, 2020).
